intro: Rosa arvensis var. bedoei, commonly known as the Bedoei dog rose, is a variant of the field rose native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a shrub with thorny stems and compound leaves, typical of the Rosa genus. The flowers are usually pale pink to white, with five petals, and bloom in early summer. The plant produces red, hairy fruits known as hips, which are used in traditional medicine. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in woodland edges.
